docs.abstract: While the Bush team has been trying to limit de-Baathification in Baghdad, it was carrying out its own de-Democratization in the Justice Department.
docs.snippet: While the Bush team has been trying to limit de-Baathification in Baghdad, it was carrying out its own de-Democratization in the Justice Department.
docs.lead_paragraph: If you want to know why we are losing in Iraq, go back and read this story that ran on the front page of The Times on Saturday. It began like this:

The distance between poet and poem is wonderfully, sometimes perilously, elastic. This shrewd poem’s particularness creates an intimacy that feels both personal and social. I wouldn’t call the details universal, I would call them recognizable. We may not know who Kathleen is, for example, but we know what it means to feel lost. The speaker (the poet?) addresses us like an old friend with an air that is both forsaken and resilient. Selected by Terrance Hayes

docs.abstract: Surrounded by dandelions and patches of clover, James E. Cavanaugh, Town Supervisor of Eastchester, recently began a campaign to alert homeowners to the dangers of overusing chemicals on their lawns.    ''In a nonagricultural county, we're using a surprising amount of chemicals,'' Mr. Cavanaugh said. According to the report by two environmental groups -- the New York Public Interest Research Group and Environmental Advocates -- Westchester used 96,034 gallons of liquid fertilizer and 680,968 pounds of solid pesticides in 1997, placing it fourth and eighth, respectively, among the state's counties.
docs.lead_paragraph: Surrounded by dandelions and patches of clover, James E. Cavanaugh, Town Supervisor of Eastchester, recently began a campaign to alert homeowners to the dangers of overusing chemicals on their lawns.

docs.abstract: The Justice Department has delivered a strong message to multibillion-dollar companies and their executives: No one is “too big to jail.”
docs.snippet: The Justice Department has delivered a strong message to multibillion-dollar companies and their executives: No one is “too big to jail.”
docs.lead_paragraph: For too long, big corporations and financial institutions have been able to pay fines for their misdeeds and settle civil cases while escaping criminal indictment. Now, in the final days of the Obama administration, the Department of Justice has delivered a strong message to multibillion-dollar companies and their executives: No one is “too big to jail.”

docs.abstract: Ms. Letang educates parents and prospective students about the college and admissions process at Fairfield University.
docs.snippet: Ms. Letang educates parents and prospective students about the college and admissions process at Fairfield University.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nakia Letang, 33, is an associate admissions director at Fairfield University in Fairfield, Conn.

docs.abstract: Catherine Jones reviews East Japanese Restaurant in Teaneck, NJ; photo (M)
docs.snippet: Catherine Jones reviews East Japanese Restaurant in Teaneck, NJ; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: I WALKED into East Japanese Restaurant and immediately began relaxing. For one thing, I was walking around in my socks. For another, I was headed for a low table surrounded by sunken seats, both finished in a dark, soothing polished wood. On our way, the host led me past an inviting central kitchen whose focal point was a wood-fire grill steaming with the flavors of freshly cooked shrimp and eggplant.

docs.abstract: At the orphanage his father founded as part of his missionary work in the Philippines, the children still toss around a football Tim Tebow left for them.
docs.snippet: At the orphanage his father founded as part of his missionary work in the Philippines, the children still toss around a football Tim Tebow left for them.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAMSUGOD, the Philippines — The last time Tim Tebow visited his father’s orphanage here in the remote hills of Mindanao island, he stood at the edge of a grassy yard and told the children to make a loop with their arms. Then, to their amazement, he threw a football right through them.

docs.abstract: Tenants at Manhattan House have been considering whether to go to court again about damage they say was deliberately done by sponsors to drive tenants out.
docs.snippet: Tenants at Manhattan House have been considering whether to go to court again about damage they say was deliberately done by sponsors to drive tenants out.
docs.lead_paragraph: FOR several years, tenants at Manhattan House, the huge landmark white brick apartment complex at 200 East 66th Street, have complained bitterly about noisy construction, dust, debris and environmental hazards as many of the 581 apartments in five connected towers were renovated and converted to condominiums.

headline.main: A Good Example as a Neighbor?
headline.print_headline: A Good Example As a Neighbor?

docs.abstract: When Tiger Woods is ready to compete again, he could do worse than talk to Lance Armstrong, who knows how to confront adversity.
docs.snippet: When Tiger Woods is ready to compete again, he could do worse than talk to Lance Armstrong, who knows how to confront adversity.
docs.lead_paragraph: He’s had a wretched three weeks, but Tiger Woods is the athlete of the decade, according to an Associated Press poll.

headline.main: In Armstrong, an Example for Woods
headline.print_headline: In Armstrong, An Example For Woods

docs.abstract: Dorothy Hayden Truscott, who died on Tuesday, was one of the greatest female bridge players of all time. Here, a diagramed deal with her partner, Emma Jean Hawes.
